alert.note: Alert for Des Moines; Henry; Jefferson; Lee; Van Buren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 12 at 9:51AM CDT until April 12 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Extreme Fire Conditions Today... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR EXTREME FIRE CONDITIONS FOR PORTIONS OF WEST CENTRAL ILLINOIS AND NORTHEAST MISSOURI... The National Weather Service in Quad Cities has issued a Red Flag Warning for extreme fire conditions, which is in effect until 8 PM CDT this evening. * TIMING...11 AM to 8 PM CDT. * WINDS...Southwest 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 22 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the upper 70s. * LIGHTNING... * IMPACTS...Any fires will spread rapidly and be very difficult to control in these dangerous conditions. Outdoor burning should be avoided.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Des Moines; Henry; Jefferson; Lee; Van Buren
